alert.note: Alert for Hansford; Lipscomb; Ochiltree (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 23 at 2:18PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...The eastern Oklahoma Panhandle and the southwestern, south central, north central and northeastern Texas Panhandle. * WHEN...From 7 PM CDT this evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - After a prolonged period of dry conditions, a combination of heavy rainfall rates over dry landmass and urban areas which may occur in several rounds of rainfall, this has prompted the Flood Watch across this outlook area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
